channel.title: Theater
channel.description:
Hey a pretty gay post by me, but anyways... I went to watch the theater production of "bouncers" last week and it made me laugh so much. It was with my school as i wouldn't go to a theater production outside of school, but i just realised.. why don't i go to these things outside of school?
I've seen - Bouncers, Blood brothers and Woman in black
Bouncers is a comedy Blood brothers is a tragedy and woman in black is a horror.
Each one made me feel very emotional in the ways it wanted me to (e.g. a comedy to make me laugh and a horror to make me scared).
The main thing I'm thinking about is how much more scary it was seeing woman in black then seeing any movie that was scary because its just on a screen wherase the actual horror is being acted out right in front of you.
So i made this post for a reason to ask if anyone else goes to theater productions and do you go with your school or without?
So your views on anything to do with theater discuss away....

item.title: Theater
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Bloody private schooled british fucks.

Heh, most schools here take people to the “theater” to see something like a play they are studying, because it helps, like romeo and juliet.

Even still, your comment was so lothy like i should come out with some kind of insult, ill save it for IRC :).

Read full topic

item.title: Theater
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

=] <3 yz85Racer.

Yeah i am doing drama GCSE, it’s not one of my best subjects (well i had a choice between geography and drama so i picked drama) but i do enjoy doing drama a lot =]

Also anyone suggest any good plays to watch? ty

oh edit - i lol’d at the bit where that hard looking man walked onto the stage saying “Susie is sexy” i mainly lol’d because i was sitting with my gf and her name is susie =]

Read full topic

item.title: Theater
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Ah saw bouncers in eastbourne (Near brighton, in east sussex).

And i saw blood brothers about 2 years ago in london.

What did you think of bouncers? (I thought it was a bit boring but i thought some of the jokes were quite funny and was well played).

Read full topic
